poach.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to cook an egg in or over gently boiling water, without its shell
poach.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to gently cook food, especially fish, in a small amount of boiling water, milk etc
poach.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Poach the salmon in white wine and water.
poach.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to illegally catch or shoot animals, birds, or fish, especially on private land without permission
poach.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Deer have been poached here for years.
poach.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to persuade someone who belongs to another organization, team etc to leave it and join yours, especially in a secret or dishonest way
poach.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: That company’s always poaching our staff.

poach.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: to take and use someone else’s ideas unfairly or illegally
poach.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to persuade someone to leave an organization and come and work for you
